What is the purpose of the `getreceivedbyaccount` command in Verus?
The `getreceivedbyaccount` command returns the total amount of VRSC received by addresses with a specified account name, in transactions with at least a certain number of confirmations.

getreceivedbyaccount "account" ( minconf ) DEPRECATED. Returns the total amount received by addresses with <account> in transactions with at least [minconf] confirmations. Arguments: 1. "account"   (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error. 2. minconf     (numeric, optional, default=1) Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times. Result: amount       (numeric) The total amount in VRSC received for this account. Examples: Amount received by the default account with at least 1 confirmation > verus getreceivedbyaccount "" Amount received at the tabby account including unconfirmed amounts with zero confirmations > verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 0 The amount with at least 6 confirmation, very safe > verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 6 As a json rpc call > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreceivedbyaccount", "params": ["tabby", 6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getreceivedbyaccount
What is the default value for the `minconf` parameter in the `getreceivedbyaccount` command?
The default value for the `minconf` parameter in the `getreceivedbyaccount` command is 1, which means that only transactions with at least 1 confirmation are included in the calculation.

getreceivedbyaccount "account" ( minconf ) DEPRECATED. Returns the total amount received by addresses with <account> in transactions with at least [minconf] confirmations. Arguments: 1. "account"   (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error. 2. minconf     (numeric, optional, default=1) Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times. Result: amount       (numeric) The total amount in VRSC received for this account. Examples: Amount received by the default account with at least 1 confirmation > verus getreceivedbyaccount "" Amount received at the tabby account including unconfirmed amounts with zero confirmations > verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 0 The amount with at least 6 confirmation, very safe > verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 6 As a json rpc call > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreceivedbyaccount", "params": ["tabby", 6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How can I use the `getreceivedbyaccount` command to get the total amount received by the default account with at least 1 confirmation?
You can use the `getreceivedbyaccount` command to get the total amount received by the default account with at least 1 confirmation by running the following command: `verus getreceivedbyaccount ""`

What is the purpose of the `account` parameter in the `getreceivedbyaccount` command?

The `account` parameter in the `getreceivedbyaccount` command specifies the account name for which to retrieve the total received amount. If set to an empty string `""`, it represents the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error.

getreceivedbyaccount "account" ( minconf ) DEPRECATED. Returns the total amount received by addresses with <account> in transactions with at least [minconf] confirmations. Arguments: 1. "account"   (string, required) MUST be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. Passing any other string will result in an error. 2. minconf     (numeric, optional, default=1) Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times. Result: amount       (numeric) The total amount in VRSC received for this account. Examples: Amount received by the default account with at least 1 confirmation > verus getreceivedbyaccount "" Amount received at the tabby account including unconfirmed amounts with zero confirmations > verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 0 The amount with at least 6 confirmation, very safe > verus getreceivedbyaccount "tabby" 6 As a json rpc call > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreceivedbyaccount", "params": ["tabby", 6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How can I use the `getreceivedbyaccount` command as a JSON RPC call to get the total amount received by the "tabby" account with at least 6 confirmations?

You can use the `getreceivedbyaccount` command as a JSON RPC call to get the total amount received by the "tabby" account with at least 6 confirmations by running the following command:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreceivedbyaccount", "params": ["tabby", 6] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
